description: Borrowed from Latin ordino, ordinatus. Doublet of ordain.

adjectives.description: ordinate (comparative more ordinate, superlative most ordinate)

entries.meaning: arranged regularly in rows; orderly; disposed or arranged in an orderly or regular fashion.
(geometry) The second of the two terms by which a point is referred to, in a system of fixed rectilinear coordinate (Cartesian coordinate) axes.
examples:
The point 
  
    
      
        (
        3
        ,
        2
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle (3,2)}
  
 has 3 as its abscissa and 2 as its ordinate.

entries.meaning: (geometry) The vertical line representing an axis of a Cartesian coordinate system, on which the ordinate (sense above) is shown.

verbs.description: ordinate (third-person singular simple present ordinates, present participle ordinating, simple past and past participle ordinated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, uncommon) to ordain a priest, or consecrate a bishop
(transitive) to align a series of objects
